result.execSummary:
The defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction; credit for 3 days served as to count 1, count 2 to be served consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS, concurrent with the following conditions:
as to each count:
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
-AODA assessment and any treatment.
-Sex offender assessment and any treatment.
-No contact with the victim.
-No contact with 'significant others' under the age of 18 years.
-Follow all Family Court orders: child support payments to be established within 30 days.
-Pay for birth expenses.
-Maintain employment.
-Other counseling needs to be determined.
-Submit DNA sample and pay applicable costs.
-Pay DNA surcharge as to each count.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
Failure to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges will result in entry of civil judgment.
The Court will authorize expungement under 973.015 effective 1 year from the date of successful completion of probation term providing that the defendant has no new offenses rising to the level of probable cause.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has VOP
State moves to amend to 2 counts of Fourth Degree Sexual Assualt, class A misdemeanors, pursuant to 940.225(3m).
To each of the amended counts:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty of amended charges  and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case is adjourned to 3-17-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.  Defendant is remanded.

Violation report for missed telephone contact on 3-5-2014 filed with the court.
Court will address on next court date of 3-13-2014.

Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 38 on 3-13-2014 at 8:15 for plea.
Court withdrew order for bench warrant from 2-27-2014.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ORIGINAL INFORMATION filed.
Defendant fails to appear.  Court issues a bench warrant with a remand.
After counsels left the courtroom, the defendant's family advised the court bailiff that defendant is in custody.  Per check with jail , defendant was picked up on a VOP yesterday at 5:06pm and is in custody.
Case is adjourned to 2-28-2014 at 8:15 for arraignment.
Clerk confirmed date with counsels.

Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Step Nolten for Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO DA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/19/14.

Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Markell Nathaniel Mitchell in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  DATE SET AT ADA'S REQUEST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
